content:
Hi all! Starting today (but I don't know exactly what to bisect) I've started seeing 4 failures with 

error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm/src/context.rs:178:13: data-layout for target `i686-pc-windows-msvc`, `e-m:x-p:32:32-p270:32:32-p271:32:32-p272:64:64-i64:64-f80:32-n8:16:32-a:0:32-S32`, differs from LLVM target's `i686-pc-windows-msvc` default layout, `e-m:x-p:32:32-p270:32:32-p271:32:32-p272:64:64-i64:64-f80:128-n8:16:32-a:0:32-S32`

which seems super weird. Same error on llvm 14 release branch and llvm/main. Any advice on what I should poke to try and resolve this? Maybe environmental on my machine somehow?
(I should note: I'm doing this on Linux, not Windows)
Ahh, that was the change I could have sworn I'd seen and then couldn't find. I'll bet that's it, and I've just been getting lucky to not see this until now (presumably due to old baselines.)
